alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; East Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 1:59PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cameron and southeastern Calcasieu Parishes through 230 PM CDT... At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm moving into Sulphur and Lake Charles. This storms is moving to the east northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Westlake, Grand Lake, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Moss Bluff, Carlyss, Hacketts Corner, Heberts Marina and Holmwood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 28 and 38. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
